DataElement.preferredName: Patient Cervical Carcinoma Diagnosis Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to the elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial regarding if a person receiving medical care, or treatment has the investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence of cervical carcinoma.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Cervical Carcinoma Diagnosis Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial regarding if a person receiving medical care, or treatment has the investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence of cervical carcinoma.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Cervical Carcinoma Diagnosis Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Cervical carcinoma may arise from either the exocervical squamous epithelium or the endocervical glandular epithelium.  The major histologic types of cervical carcinoma are: squamous carcinoma, adenocarcinoma, adenosquamous carcinoma, adenoid cystic carcinoma and undifferentiated carcinoma.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma arising from either the exocervical squamous epithelium or the endocervical glandular epithelium. The major histologic types of cervical carcinoma are squamous cell carcinoma and adenocarcinoma.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to GOG for REBOYJ by script Thu Aug 1 14:45:44 EDT 2013

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have primary
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have primary, previously untreated, histologically confirmed, locoregionally advanced invasive cervical carcinoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have histologically confirmed advanced cervical cancer

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have histologically confirmed newly diagnosed advanced cervical cancer (squamous cell carcinoma, adenocarcinoma, and adenosquamous cell carcinoma)?
